columns.name: name
columns.description: The name of the launch configuration.

columns.name: launch_configuration_arn
columns.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the launch configuration.

columns.name: created_time
columns.description: The creation date and time for the launch configuration.

columns.name: image_id
columns.description: The ID of the Amazon Machine Image (AMI) to use to launch EC2 instances.

columns.name: instance_type
columns.description: The instance type for the instances.

columns.name: associate_public_ip_address
columns.description: For Auto Scaling groups that are running in a VPC, specifies whether to assign a public IP address to the group's instances.

columns.name: kernel_id
columns.description: The ID of the kernel associated with the AMI.

columns.name: key_name
columns.description: The name of the key pair to be associated with instances.

columns.name: ramdisk_id
columns.description: The ID of the RAM disk associated with the AMI.

columns.name: ebs_optimized
columns.description: Specifies whether the launch configuration is optimized for EBS I/O (true) or not (false).

columns.name: classic_link_vpc_id
columns.description: The ID of a ClassicLink-enabled VPC to link EC2-Classic instances to.

columns.name: spot_price
columns.description: The maximum hourly price to be paid for any Spot Instance launched to fulfill the request. Spot Instances are launched when the price you specified exceeds the current Spot price.

columns.name: user_data
columns.description: The Base64-encoded user data to make available to the launched EC2 instances.

columns.name: placement_tenancy
columns.description: The tenancy of the instance, either default or dedicated. An instance with dedicated tenancy runs on isolated, single-tenant hardware and can only be launched into a VPC.

columns.name: iam_instance_profile
columns.description: The name or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the instance profile associated with the IAM role for the instance.

columns.name: instance_monitoring_enabled
columns.description: Describes whether detailed monitoring is enabled for the Auto Scaling instances.

columns.name: metadata_options_http_endpoint
columns.description: This parameter enables or disables the HTTP metadata endpoint on instances. If the parameter is not specified, the default state is enabled.

columns.name: metadata_options_put_response_hop_limit
columns.description: The desired HTTP PUT response hop limit for instance metadata requests. The larger the number, the further instance metadata requests can travel.

columns.name: metadata_options_http_tokens
columns.description: The state of token usage for your instance metadata requests. If the parameter is not specified in the request, the default state is optional.

columns.name: block_device_mappings
columns.description: A block device mapping, which specifies the block devices for the instance.

columns.name: classic_link_vpc_security_groups
columns.description: The IDs of one or more security groups for the VPC specified in ClassicLinkVPCId.

columns.name: security_groups
columns.description: A list that contains the security groups to assign to the instances in the Auto Scaling group.
